distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for bind fixes the following issues:

- A defect in BIND's handling of responses containing a DNAME answer had
the potential to trigger assertion errors in the server remotely,
thereby facilitating a denial-of-service attack. (CVE-2016-8864, bsc#1007829).

- Fix BIND to return a valid hostname in response to ldapdump queries.
(bsc#965748)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: CSAF 2.0 data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: named in ISC BIND 9.x before 9.9.9-P4, 9.10.x before 9.10.4-P4, and 9.11.x before 9.11.0-P1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and daemon exit) via a DNAME record in the answer section of a response to a recursive query, related to db.c and resolver.c.
notes.title: CVE description
